result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler Wayne Briggs

records.addlTxt:
2:56 PM Defendant Tyler Wayne Briggs appeared by video, in custody in Kettle Morraine Correctional.  Attorney Steven Daniel Johnson in court via zoom for Tyler Wayne Briggs.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Johnson has reviewed criminal complaint and waives reading and time limits. Def. waives right. Waiver of Preliminary examination filed. Atty Johnson states Def. gave authorization for script signature. Court accepts waiver and reviews form with Def. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause. State wishes to proceed to arraignment today. Information mirrors criminal complaint and filed electronically. Atty. Johnson waives reading and enters Not Guilty plea. Court accepts Not Guilty plea. Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Waiver of Attorney and Petition for Court Appointed Attorney forms mailed to Def.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:05 p.m. in Room 301. Defendant Tyler Wayne Briggs appeared by video, in custody at Kettle Moraine C.I.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. Def. has copy of complaint, Def. already advised of charges and penalties. Def. would like assistance of counsel but doesn't want case to be set out for a lengthy period of time. Court advises Def. that all options are still open as to counsel - PD, hire own, court-appointed or self-represent. Def. has contacted PD but hasn't gotten response. Statement by State, will contact PD. Court to send waiver of attorney form to Def. and Petition for court-appointed form. Case to be set for adjourned initial appearance.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Faxed Bail/Bond and Waiver of Attorney Right form to Dodge Correctional Inst.
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription

1:30 PM Defendant Tyler Wayne Briggs appeared by video, in custody @ Dodge Correctional Int. .  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin., via zoom.  Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. would like to proceed without counsel.  Court advised def. to complete waiver of atty form. State gives bail/bond recommendation.  Court orders $10,000 Signature bond with condition No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without valid prescription.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
